item.title: Hair/MU for Photo Shoot
item.description:
1 day photo shoot, August 15, 2024, 8am to 5pm in Los Angeles area. $200 plus $50 kit fee plus lunch on the day.
Cast shoot for promotion purposes, in character. 3 males, one female. Beauty and Hollywood Glam. Possibly some room for creative look if the Director likes your vision. We want two slightly different looks for the female. Female is blond - but the character is ginger. If you can do a temporary color treatment on the day.
Send resume, portfolio and contact info to Line Producer at shadowmihai@gmail.com

item.title: Indie Line Producer - LA Based
item.description:
~We Are Looking for an Indie Line Producer~ Are you a skilled and passionate line producer with a knack for scheduling and budgeting? We are looking for someone to join us on an exciting journey to bring an upcoming feature film to life!
About the Project:
Genre: Thriller/Drama/Crime Budget: Ultra Low Budget, $150,000 Assets Ready: Concept trailer and pitch deck We Are Looking For:
Location: Los Angeles-based Skills: Expertise in scheduling, budgeting, and creating a top sheet Commitment: Someone interested in staying on as line producer once the project is greenlit Attitude: A proactive, can-do attitude Passion: Genuine enthusiasm for thriller/drama/crime films Compensation:
Payment: Deferred until financing is secured Stipend: Interim stipend offered for preliminary budget work, amount negotiable
If you’re excited about collaborating on this thrilling project, have a proactive approach, and are interested in potentially staying on through production, please reach out to us at KoshkaFilmsCompany@gmail.com.
Happy Filmmaking and Successful Producing!

item.title: Producer for Independent Feature Film
item.description:
Seeking a producer for an independent film to be shot one hour outside of both Richmond and D.C., with pre-production based in New York.
Tasks include assisting in the logistical aspects of the production and assisting in casting key roles. This is a contained production with limited locations and a small cast, so our focus will be on attracting the right talent. The ideal candidate will be hands-on, ensuring we stay on track and support each other throughout the project. While it would be best to be based in NY, being close to the filming location would also be beneficial. The film will have a dialogue-driven, character-based aesthetic (think Linklater or Baumbach). While not essential, a passion for this genre of filmmaking would be advantageous.
This is my second feature film. My first had a festival run and a curated week-long screening in NYC.

item.title: Director for Indie Adventure Short
item.description:
Indie adventure short seeking a director to join its collaborative team! 'INAPPROPRIATE', the flagship production of Fighter Productions, is a 15-minute adventure short film about a young biracial artist wrestling with life and her purpose in the world in the aftermath of her father’s death, making a last-ditch attempt to reconnect with his spirit. 'Inappropriate' has received multiple accolades, including holding the #1 adventure short listing on Coverfly’s Red List in 2023.
Our goal is to finish the film for a late summer premiere and usher in a wave of Independent Projects for our production company, Fighter Productions. Ultimately, we would love to take this film to the festival circuit. Additionally, we want to destigmatize the conversation around how we deal with grief and how we frame family and culture in our stories. Our mission is to use the art of storytelling to connect audiences and artists of disparate perspectives through this shared cord of humanity and return creative freedom to actor and audience. We are particularly passionate about sharing stories that connect to culture, adventure, and the human experience through it all. Please note, this film incorporates the writer’s own biracial Indigenous heritage and culture. While not a requirement, if you are Native, we highly encourage you to apply!
This job is FOR you if: • You are a supremely creative thinker who gets the creative vision of a project and can collaborate effectively with measurable success. • You are passionate about the subject material and want to be part of a scrappy, DIY production team. • You have a great sense of humor (even under pressure) and a high code of ethics. • You bring out the genuine best in actors and argue for the creative flourishing of the project without sacrificing the means to meet an end. • You are able to work professionally and productively with individuals of diverse perspectives and views. • You run a tight ship and are able to work within the boundaries of the budget. • You value independent arts and entertainment. • You are a highly effective communicator. • You resonate with this statement: good stories are worth telling and it takes a team to share that impact.
The following qualifications are a MUST: • Past directing experience (credit for unpaid, student, or volunteer work given) • Comfortable directing a film that will include on camera hand-to-hand combat. • Expert communicator via multiple channels and within a highly collaborative, fast-paced environment. • Punctual and professional. Period. • Reliable transportation. • Deeply creative and able to share in the storytelling. • A deep belief in the connection between artists and audience.
The following characteristics are NON-NEGOTIABLE: • Mission focused and project oriented. • Reliable, flexible, self-motivated. • Unflappable in the face of change. • Sense of purpose. You are a whole real person, not an automaton. We are not interested in working with a robot. • Knows how to work with actors. No seriously. You bring out their best and you make the set a fun, creative place to explore. You give clear, actionable direction. • Good listener: you are able to defend the artistic integrity of the work while also following through on deadlines and instruction from producer. • Ability and confidence to ask for what you need. From actors. From production. You do not expect to be handheld. • Respectful, confident problem solver. • You keep post in mind (you direct in a way that post-production can amplify the work, not spend precious time going back and fixing things that were preventable.)
The following qualifications are a PLUS: • Experience crowdfunding. • Have directed fantasy (to include VFX) • Ability to fill other crew positions with referrals. Ability to similarly make actor recommendations. • Love The Princess Bride and regularly weave well-timed movie quotes into daily conversation. Witty, not obsessive. • Understand the government realities of tribal dialogues.
This position will be funded on a CROWDFUNDING basis. Therefore, there is NO guarantee of pay. PLEASE DO NOT APPLY UNLESS YOU ARE COMFORTABLE COMMITTING TO THIS! We believe in paying artists fairly as able and the payment received will be determined based upon available funds. We anticipate this project will include a 2-month (8-week) pre-production period (including the crowdfund campaign, and we are willing to do virtual work where feasible) and 3 day shoot that takes place in Colorado. Must be willing to work as a LOCAL HIRE.
To apply, please submit a personal cover letter, resume pdf, and and relevant demo reel links.
Thank you, and good luck! We look forward to your application.

item.title: Producer for Indie Adventure Short
item.description:
Independent short adventure film seeking a producer to join its collaborative team! 'INAPPROPRIATE', the flagship production of Fighter Productions, is a 15-minute adventure short film about a young biracial artist wrestling with life and her purpose in the world in the aftermath of her father’s death, making a last-ditch attempt to reconnect with his spirit. 'Inappropriate' has received multiple accolades, including holding the #1 adventure short listing on Coverfly’s Red List in 2023.
Our goal is to finish the film for a late summer premiere and usher in a wave of Independent Projects for our production company, Fighter Productions. Ultimately, we would love to take this film to the festival circuit. Additionally, we want to destigmatize the conversation around how we deal with grief and how we frame family and culture in our stories. Our mission is to use the art of storytelling to connect audiences and artists of disparate perspectives through this shared cord of humanity and return creative freedom to actor and audience. We are particularly passionate about sharing stories that connect to culture, adventure, and the human experience through it all. Please note, this film incorporates the writer’s own biracial Indigenous heritage and culture. While not a requirement, if you are Native, we highly encourage you to apply!
This job is FOR you if: • You are a supremely organized, creative thinker able to track multiple responsibilities in a fast paced, highly collaborative environment. • You are passionate about the subject material and want to be part of a scrappy, DIY production team. • You are upbeat and able to find the good in everything. • You have a great sense of humor (even under pressure) and a high code of ethics. • You are willing and able to wear multiple hats to get shit done, but you never sacrifice the means to meet an end. • You are able to work professionally and productively with individuals of diverse perspectives and views. • You value independent arts and entertainment. • You resonate with this statement: good stories are worth telling and told well they have the capacity to bridge divides and create meaningful conversation between individuals.
The following qualifications are a MUST: • Past producer experience (credit for unpaid, student, or volunteer work given) • Expert communicator via multiple channels and within a highly collaborative, fast-paced environment. • Punctual and professional. Period. • Reliable transportation. • Innate ability to see the bigger picture and follow through on tough calls with empathy and effective communication.
The following characteristics are NON-NEGOTIABLE: • Mission focused and project oriented. • Reliable, flexible, self-motivated. You know yourself and are a better team player and leader for it. • Unflappable in the face of change. • Sense of purpose. You are a whole real person, not an automaton. We are not interested in working with a robot. • Professional relationship wizard. • Respectful, confident problem solver. • A true collaborator who is comfortable in a leadership role.
The following qualifications are a PLUS: • Experience crowdfunding. • Ability to fill other crew positions with referrals. • Familiar with chain-of-title. • Love The Princess Bride and regularly weave well-timed movie quotes into daily conversation. Witty, not obsessive. • Understand the government realities of tribal dialogues.
This position will be funded on a crowdfunding basis. Therefore, there is no guarantee of pay. PLEASE DO NOT APPLY UNLESS YOU ARE COMFORTABLE COMMITTING TO THIS! We believe in paying artists fairly as able and the payment received will be determined based upon available funds. We anticipate this project to include a 2-month (8-week) pre-production period (including the crowdfund campaign, we are willing to work virtually where feasible) and 3-day shoot on location in Colorado anticipated in early August. Must be willing to work as a LOCAL HIRE.
To apply, please submit a personal cover letter and your resume as a pdf file.
Thank you! We look forward to your application!

item.title: Copy Writer (P/T remote) to fundraise via email for Last Evangelist TV: a Biblical Ministry
item.description:
Is your passion writing about cutting-edge topics? Do you delight in capturing the voice of a ministry to establish branding? Have you had successful experience with email conversion campaigns? Are you ministry-minded and familiar with the responsive model of nonprofit funding?
We’re counting on you to create email content and marketing strategies with insights and techniques of brand recognition.
You’ll write email campaigns to fundraise for Episode 2 of the TV Series. The Trailer is at DavidHeavener.tv/trailer/
Qualifications: * Successful Fundraising in your portfolio * Thrive under spontaneous pressure and last-minute deadlines * Minimum 10-hour work per week availability
You may be the right fit if you have the following: * Excellent storytelling * Attention to detail * Proficient in a CRM with the responsive fundraising model (Such as Virtuous, Bloomerang, Salesforce, Blackbaud, Hubspot, etc.) * Agree with our Statement of Faith: https://davidheavener.tv/statement-of-faith/
Responsibilities * Design and optimize email templates for improved engagement * Utilize A/B testing and optimization efforts to improve email open and click-through rates * Isolate copy for various ministry needs, including sales, fundraising, etc. * Report segmentation, analytics and performance tracking * Deliver copy in as timely a manner as possible * Determine opportunities to improve effectiveness to insure all campaigns meet expected goals * Ensure that all copy aligns with the consistent voice of the ministry * Support continuous improvement guidelines by proactively reporting challenges or obstacles to the lead copywriter that may hinder or weaken performance
A little about us… Our Values: 1. Honor Yeshua in all we do 2. Establish relationships based on trust and respect 3. Maintain integrity and excellence 4. Honor our Creator with responsible stewardship
Please note the following This is a remote position open to all. Those with “disabilities” are encouraged to apply. This is for a Biblical ministry (non-profit ) in Indiana near Louisville, KY. We may ultimately offer more or less than the posted range, and the ranges may be modified in the future. The salary range will be based on several factors, including, but not limited to, relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, geographic location, and organizational needs. Selection must be limited to individuals with valid work visas.
Please submit resume with cover letter and 3 writing samples of various successful email campaigns to David@DavidHeavener.tv

item.title: Producer for a SAG Microbudget Short film
item.description:
Seeking a skilled, experienced, organized producer for a (15 page) character driven SAG micro budget short film.
I was inspired to write this film because of my desire to live my dream of being a professional dancer. The lack of support and understanding I received combined with watching my father unhappy most of his life because he lived the status quo is the impetus for this character driven story. Fortunately, I have followed my dreams, but our protagonist has not. Questioning her own life choices in middle age she is also confronted with her father's onset of dementia. The story explores the complex father/daughter relationship, the challenges of caring for a sr. parent and the discovery of secret lost dreams. Dance is also woven into the story highlighting the high statistics of teenage homelessness. “Don’t Die with your Dream Inside” is the message of this story.
I am looking for someone who is a good communicator, experienced working with SAG contracts, organized, reliable, understands chain of title, is collaborative and available for pre-production tasks.
This passion project is set to tentatively shoot Mid July 2024 for 3 days in LA with an estimated budget of $15K. A Seed and Spark fundraising campaign is planned. Producers pay: $300/day, copy, credit. (additional pre-production compensation will be negotiated)
Looking for a producer who is interested in participating in crowdfunding for the film.
If interested please send over your resume, recent producing projects, website and in what ways you relate to this story.
Send to: pamelah777@yahoo.com Subject line: DREAM Thanks in advance for your interest! In gratitude, Pam Heffler Actress/Dancer/Writer//Producer @pamelaheffler on IG www.imdb.com/name/nm0373589

item.title: Director for a SAG Microbudget short film
item.description:
Seeking an experienced artistically passionate, actor friendly director for a short (15 page) SAG micro budget character driven film. I was inspired to write this film because of my desire to live my dream of being a professional dancer. The lack of support and understanding I received combined with watching my father unhappy most of his life because he lived the status quo is the impetus for this character driven story. Fortunately, I have followed my dreams, but our protagonist has not. Questioning her own life choices in middle age she is also confronted with her father's onset of dementia. The story explores the complex father/daughter relationship, the challenges of caring for a sr. parent and the discovery of secret lost dreams. Dance is also woven into the story highlighting the high statistics of teenage homelessness. “Don’t Die with your Dream Inside” is the message of this story. I am looking for an experienced director who loves working with actors (obviously), resonates with this story, likes to collaborate and communicates well. This passion project is tentatively set to shoot mid-July 2024 in the LA area. An estimated budget of $15K for a 3-day shoot. Planning on doing a Seed & Spark Fundraising campaign. Director Pay: $350/day plus pre production compensation Helpful if interested in collaborating on a fundraising campaign.
If interested please send over your resume, demo reels, website and why you feel this project would be a good fit to collaborate on. Send to pamelah777@yahoo.com Subject line: DREAM I am looking forward to reading your reply. With sincere Gratitude, Pam Heffler Actress/Dancer/Writer/Producer
